net.proteusframework.ui.miwt

Class MIWTSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.MIWTSession
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, EventListener, HttpSessionBindingListener, net.proteusframework.core.locale.LocaleContextSource

    public final class MIWTSession
extends Object
implements Serializable, HttpSessionBindingListener, net.proteusframework.core.locale.LocaleContextSource

    An MIWTSession object holds the necessary objects to support running a set of applications for a single user's session. This does not imply any sort of user login required, but simply that an MIWTSession assumes only one user will be accessing it through a single interface. There should not be two users accessing a MIWTSession nor a single user accessing through multiple points (i.e. two HTTP sessions linked to the same MIWTSession).

    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

                      Object oldValue,
                      Object newValue)
        Fires a property change event. No event is fired if oldValue and newValue are equal and non-null.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - The name of the property.
        oldValue - The old value, may be null.
        newValue - The new value, may be null.

      • fireStateRequestEvent

        public void fireStateRequestEvent(Class<? extends MIWTApplication> applicationClass,
                         long processId,
                         Map<String,Serializable> state)
                           throws NoSuchMethodException,
                                  InstantiationException,
                                  IllegalAccessException,
                                  InvocationTargetException
        Fire a state request event to an application. If the process ID is less than one or does not exist in the session, an existing application that implements the application class will be used. If no matching application is available a new instance of the application will be started and sent the state request event.
        Parameters:
        applicationClass - The class of the application.
        processId - The process ID of the application.
        state - The state to request.
        Throws:
        NoSuchMethodException - if an appropriate constructor does not exist.
        InstantiationException - if an exception occurs creating the application.
        IllegalAccessException - if the constructor is not public.
        InvocationTargetException - if an exception occurs creating the application.

      • fireStateRequestEvent

        public void fireStateRequestEvent(MIWTApplication app,
                         Map<String,Serializable> state)
        Fire a state request event to an application. If the process ID is less than one or does not exist in the session, a new instance of the application will be started and sent the state request event.
        Parameters:
        app - The application to send the state request to.
        state - The state to request.

      • fireStateRequestEvent

        public void fireStateRequestEvent(String applicationClassName,
                         long processId,
                         Map<String,Serializable> state)
                           throws ClassNotFoundException,
                                  NoSuchMethodException,
                                  InstantiationException,
                                  IllegalAccessException,
                                  InvocationTargetException
        Calls fireStateRequestEvent(Class,long,Map) after loading the application class specified.
        Parameters:
        applicationClassName - The class name of the application.
        processId - The process ID of the application.
        state - The state to request.
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - if the class cannot be found.
        NoSuchMethodException - if an appropriate constructor does not exist.
        InstantiationException - if an exception occurs creating the application.
        IllegalAccessException - if the constructor is not public.
        InvocationTargetException - if an exception occurs creating the application.
        See Also:
        fireStateRequestEvent(java.lang.Class, long, java.util.Map)

      • getApplicationByName

        @Nullable
public MIWTApplication getApplicationByName(String name)
        Get a running instance of an application with the given name. If more than one application has the name it is undefined which instance will be returned.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the application, as returned by MIWTApplication.getName().
        Returns:
        MIWTApplication instances or null if there are no applications that have the given name.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • initApp

        public void initApp(MIWTApplication app)
        Initializes and starts an MIWT application. The init() method of the application is called and this application is added to the apps map of this WindowManager. Please note that the application will not be available from getApplications until after the init() method is finished.
        Parameters:
        app - The application to start.

      • initAppByClass

        public MIWTApplication initAppByClass(Class<? extends MIWTApplication> appClass)
                               throws NoSuchMethodException,
                                      InstantiationException,
                                      IllegalAccessException,
                                      InvocationTargetException
        Initializes and starts a MIWT application by calling initApp using the MIWTApplication class given by appClass. The MIWTApplication is constructed using the constructor that takes an MIWTSession as the only parameter.
        Parameters:
        appClass - The application class.
        Returns:
        the application instance.
        Throws:
        NoSuchMethodException - if an appropriate constructor does not exist.
        InstantiationException - if an exception occurs creating the application.
        IllegalAccessException - if the constructor is not public.
        InvocationTargetException - if an exception occurs creating the application.

        public boolean isDestroyed()
        Check if the session has been destroyed.
        Returns:
        true if the session has been destroyed.

      • render

        public void render(net.proteusframework.internet.http.Request request,
          net.proteusframework.internet.http.Response response,
          Map<String,String[]> renderState,
          Map<String,String> extraFields,
          @Nullable
          Component component)
            throws IOException
        Render the component. This method may render dialogs associated with the component or its application.
        Parameters:
        request - the request.
        response - the response.
        renderState - map of Strings
        extraFields - Map of name-value pairs that specify extra hidden values that should be placed into the form.
        component - optional component to render. Callers should make sure an elementPrefix is set that is unique to the caller.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • renderIncremental

                     net.proteusframework.internet.http.Response response,
                     @Nullable
                     Component component)
                       throws IOException

        Parameters:

        response - the response.
        component - optional component. Callers should make sure an elementPrefix is set that is unique to the caller.
        Throws:

        prefix - the prefix.

      • setUserPreferences

        public void setUserPreferences(Preferences userPreferences)
        Set the root of the user preferences specifically for MIWT use. If set certain components may save UI preferences. The intent is a best-effort approach, items of functional importance will not be stored here.
        Parameters:
        userPreferences - the user preferences object, null will use memory based preferences.

      • valueBound
